alert.note: Alert for Benton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 8:25PM CDT until March 24 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN MARSHALL...NORTHWESTERN BENTON...FAYETTE...WESTERN HARDEMAN AND SOUTHERN HAYWOOD COUNTIES... At 825 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dancyville to near Mt Pleasant, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Lamar, Whiteville, Somerville, Byhalia, Snow Lake Shores, Mt Pleasant, Hillville, Michigan City, Red Banks, Canaan, Lagrange, Dancyville, Slayden, Warren, Macon, Oakland, Piperton, Rossville and Ashland. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
